but if Sarah , the former public relations executive prefers to stay out of the limelight , it is because she wants to see the centre stage reserved for her husband .但如果说曾为公关经理的莎拉不喜欢站在聚光灯下的话，那也是因为她想把舞台留给丈夫。

entry.def: If someone is in the limelight, a lot of attention is being paid to them, because they are famous or because they have done something very unusual or exciting.

example.ex: Tony has now been thrust into the limelight, with a high-profile job.
example.tran: 托尼现在一下子成了众人关注的中心，因为他有一份经常出镜、见报的工作。

sentences.sentence: "when Congress investigates it brings the full glare of publicity to the agency"

means.word_mean: 2. a lamp consisting of a flame directed at a cylinder of lime with a lens to concentrate the light; formerly used for stage lighting

auth_sentence.content: They always protest anything only to live in limelight.

sentences.en: I hated the limelight and found it unbearable.
sentences.cn: 我讨厌惹人注目, 觉得那实在令人难以忍受。

means.word_mean: (不)是公众关注的中心； ( 不) 引人注目

sentences.en: If you are married to a Prime Minister, you are always in the limelight.
sentences.cn: 要是你嫁给某位首相，你就永远都是众人关注的焦点。
